Class BallPowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite
      • Ball
        • BallPowerUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Tokenizable

    public class BallPowerUp
extends Ball
implements Tokenizable, java.io.Serializable
    This is the ball power up class that implements Tokenizable and extends Ball class. This is also serializable. This power up adds len number of balls to the snake with which it collides.
    Author:
    SHUBHAM THAKRAL, TANMAY BANSAL
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BallPowerUp(int[] screenCoordinates, int len)
      It calls super class constructor with screenCoordinates and assign len to len

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void action(Snake snake)
      This implements the action method of Tokenizable interface which calls snake.addBalls(len) method to increase its length.
      void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      This overrides the render method of Sprite class as along with the image of sprite, we also want to display its length.
      void update(double time)
      This overrides the update method of Ball class because this power up doesn't move left right but in downward direction.

      • Methods inherited from class Ball

        setPositionX, toString

      • Methods inherited from class Sprite

        addVelocity, bottomIntersects, forceSpriteCorrectly, forceSpriteOnBottom, forceSpriteOnLeft, forceSpriteOnRight, getBottomBoundary, getBoundary, getLeftBoundary, getRightBoundary, getTopBoundary, getTopHalfBoundary, intersects, leftIntersects, outOfFrame, rightIntersects, setImage, setImage, setImage, setImagePath, setPosition, setPositionY, setVelocity

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BallPowerUp

        public BallPowerUp(int[] screenCoordinates,
                   int len)
        It calls super class constructor with screenCoordinates and assign len to len
        Parameters:
        screenCoordinates - is an array of upper and lower bounds of the screen in XY plane. It is taken so that objects can know the boundaries of screen.
        len - is the number of balls this power up will add to the snake's length

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        This overrides the update method of Ball class because this power up doesn't move left right but in downward direction.
        Overrides:
        update in class Ball
        Parameters:
        time - is duration for which we want to update

      • render

        public void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        This overrides the render method of Sprite class as along with the image of sprite, we also want to display its length.
        Overrides:
        render in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        gc - is the GraphicContext of Canvas where we draw the image

      • action

        public void action(Snake snake)
        This implements the action method of Tokenizable interface which calls snake.addBalls(len) method to increase its length.
        Specified by:
        action in interface Tokenizable
        Parameters:
        snake - is the snake object on which we want to perform action
